original: Ekblom, Einar Laurentius, fil. dr, lektor, Göteborg, f. 10/8/90 i Norrköp. av kommissionär A. F. E. o. Amelie Andersson. G. 22 m. Henny Rylan-der. Barn: Anders f. 22, Bengt 26, Lars 28. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 09, fil. mag.J Upps. 12, fil. lic. 15, fil. dr 17, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 18, delt. i skolöverstyr. feriekurs i franska i Strängnäs 20. Res. t. Erankr. 10, Eng^l. 11 o. 14, Tyskl. 21. Vik. lär. i Hässleholm 17, vik. lektor v. Gbgs latin 19, e. o. lektor i Uddevalla 19-21, lektor i Hudiksvall 20, lektor i eng. o. franska v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 28. Timlär. v. Gbgs samsk. 36-45 o. v. Sigrid Rudebecks sk. sed. 45. Skolöverstyr. omb. v. realex. i Bollnäs 26, v. Sigrid Rudebecks sk. i Gbg 42, 43 o. 44, led. av ex:ndn f. priv. i Gbg sed. 34. Skr.: The place-nam^s of Wiilt-shire. Their orig. and history (grad:-avh. 17), Kortfatt. eng. synonymbok (23), Aktuella ord, supplem :häfte t. Wenström-Harlock Sv.-eng. ordbok (24), Gonjunctional as in post-position (Hudiksvalls lärov. årsred. 25-26), Skenbar o. verkl. betyd, i eng. (33), Om språkhist. o. språkvetenskap i skolan (26 :e sv. lärov :lär :mötets i Sthlm berätt. 35), Studentens eng.-sv. ordförråd (43), utg. Selected short stories v^ith expl. notes (20), Strachey: Florence Nightingale (37), art. o. rec. RNO.
translated: Ekblom, Einar Laurentius, PhD, lecturer, Gothenburg, b. 10/8/90 in Norrköping, son of commissioner A.F.E. and Amelie Andersson. Married in 1922 to Henny Rylander and has three sons: Anders (b. 22), Bengt (b. 26), and Lars (b. 28). Completed secondary school in Norrköping in 1909, earned a Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1912, a Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1915, and a PhD in Philosophy degree in 1917. Completed a probationary year at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1918 and participated in a school superintendent's French vacation course in Strängnäs in 1920. Traveled to France in 1910, England in 1911 and 1914, and Germany in 1921. Served as a temporary teacher in Hässleholm in 1917, temporary Latin teacher in Gothenburg in 1919, an acting lecturer in Uddevalla from 1919 to 1921, lecturer in Hudiksvall in 1920, and lecturer of English and French at the Vasa Higher Secondary School in Gothenburg since 1928. Also served as a part-time teacher at Gothenburg Samskola from 1936 to 1945 and at Sigrid Rudebeck's School since 1945. Served as a school superintendent delegate at Realexamen in Bollnäs in 1926 and at Sigrid Rudebeck's School in Gothenburg in 1942, 43, and 44. Member of the examination board for private schools in Gothenburg since 1934. Author of "The Place-names of Wiltshire. Their Origin and History" (thesis, 1917), "Conjunctional as in Post-position" (Hudiksvall Upper Secondary School's Yearbook, 1925-26), "Apparent and Real Meaning in English" (1933), "On Language History and Linguistics in School" (report at the 26th Swedish High School Teachers' Meeting in Stockholm, 1935), "Student's English-Swedish Vocabulary" (1943), and editor of "Selected Short Stories with Explanatory Notes" (1920) and "Strachey: Florence Nightingale" (1937).

hasOccupation.name: Lecturer of English and French at Vasa Higher Secondary School
